feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 10:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues due to warmer temperatures. * WHERE...The northern Copper River Basin along the Gulkana River and along Lake Louise Road.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 5:29PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Dale and northeastern Coffee Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Brundidge to near Ariton. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued June 05 at 1:57PM PDT until June 06 at 6:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Northwest to north winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range and Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM PDT Monday.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued June 05 at 1:57PM PDT until June 07 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS

entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHERN ROOKS AND SOUTHWESTERN PHILLIPS COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 530 PM CDT... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 4:35AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 100 AND 106 EXPECTED ACROSS MUCH OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS THIS AFTERNOON AND AGAIN ON MONDAY AFTERNOON... Daytime high temperatures today are expected to reach the mid to upper 90s across much of the inland areas. When combined with the humidity, afternoon heat index values will peak around a 100 to 106 range. High temperatures on Monday should be even warmer, with some locations in

entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL OKANOGAN COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 330 PM PDT...
